Thurs., Sept. 6: Stand up for those who are living in fear.
  


Rally for licenses

Thursday, Sept. 6, 10:30 a.m.
State House Annex
125 W. State St.
Trenton, NJ 08608

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Every day, thousands of New Jerseyans live in fear, knowing that their or a loved one’s daily commute could end in deportation. In the age of Trump, it’s more important than ever to make driver’s licenses available to everyone who needs one.

Rally with us on Thursday, September 6 in Trenton to make sure our legislators know that we need licenses for all. RSVP now!

Expanding licenses will make our roads safer, and it can lower the barriers that too often prevent members of vulnerable communities — like senior citizens, transgender individuals, and undocumented immigrants — from getting identification.

This is about so much more than a plastic card. It’s about standing up for New Jersey communities. Stand with us and RSVP now.

We hope to see you there.

In justice,

Amol Sinha
Executive Director
ACLU of New Jersey
